decks.notes: The deck revolves around cheating out powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Atraxa, Grand Unifier using cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with these big threats early in the game before they have a chance to respond. The deck also includes ways to protect its combo pieces with Force of Will and Veil of Summer, as well as card draw and manipulation with Brainstorm and Ponder. Overall, the deck aims to win the game quickly through its powerful combo plays.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures, such as Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, using cards like Entomb and Grief. By utilizing the reanimation spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead, the deck aims to bring these creatures back onto the battlefield for a devastating combo finish. With disruption cards like Daze and Force of Will, as well as control elements like Brazen Borrower and Troll of Khazad-d√ªm, the deck looks to disrupt the opponent's game plan while executing its own game-winning strategy.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with powerful creatures and spells, allowing for explosive plays and fast aggression. By utilizing cards like Reanimate, Animate Dead, and Grief, the deck can quickly bring back key threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan. With a mix of aggressive creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Troll of Khazad-d√ªm, along with disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Lightning Bolt, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent early in the game and maintain pressure throughout.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using Simian Spirit Guide and Elvish Spirit Guide, and then use cascade spells like Shardless Agent and Violent Outburst to put powerful creatures and spells into play for free. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with creatures like Minsc & Boo, Timeless Heroes and Endurance, while also controlling the board with cards like Wasteland and Force of Will. The inclusion of cascade spells allows for explosive turns and high levels of aggression, making it a strong aggro deck in the Legacy format.

The deck revolves around quickly assembling the combo of Cephalid Illusionist and Nomads en-Kor to mill cards from the library, triggering Narcomoeba and Dread Return to bring back Thassa's Oracle for the win. The deck uses protection spells like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo pieces, with cards like Brainstorm and Ponder to help find them. Cavern of Souls helps ensure the combo creatures can't be countered, while Teferi, Time Raveler provides disruptive elements and Prismatic Ending removes troublesome permanents. The deck aims for a fast and consistent win through its combo interactions.

The deck focuses on using various ways to fill the graveyard with powerful creatures and then quickly reanimate them onto the battlefield. It utilizes cards like Entomb, Reanimate, and Animate Dead to achieve this objective. The key strategy is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze, while also applying pressure with creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Troll of Khazad-d√ªm. The deck aims to win the game through overwhelming the opponent with powerful creatures early on.

This deck aims to quickly ramp into powerful threats like Dragon Stompy using mana acceleration cards like Ancient Tomb and Simian Spirit Guide. By locking opponent's non-basic lands with Blood Moon and disrupting their game plan with Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere, it aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures like Goblin Rabblemaster and Broadside Bombardiers. The deck focuses on punishing opponents who rely heavily on non-basic lands and spells with high casting costs, ensuring a fast and aggressive victory.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize Hive Mind as a win condition by combining it with Show and Tell to force opponents to also play copies of powerful sorceries like Pact of the Titan. Using countermagic and card draw spells to protect the combo and find key pieces, the deck can quickly assemble the necessary combo pieces to achieve a game-winning turn with Hive Mind. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like The One Ring and Sudden Substitution offer additional versatility and protection, making the deck a formidable force in the Legacy format.

The deck focuses on aggressive gameplay with a mix of creatures and spells to disrupt the opponent's strategy. It aims to establish early board presence with creatures like Tarmogoyf and Dauthi Voidwalker while utilizing cards like Abrupt Decay and Molten Collapse to control the board. The inclusion of cards like Endurance and Collector Ouphe serves to disrupt the opponent's graveyard and artifacts, respectively. Overall, the deck's strategy is to apply early pressure and maintain control through a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures, then bringing them back to the battlefield for a deadly combo. By using cards like Entomb and Reanimate, along with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze for protection, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with early threats like Grief and Archon of Cruelty. The addition of cards like Brazen Borrower and Troll of Khazad-d√ªm offers versatility and disruption, while cards like Psychic Frog provide card advantage. This deck relies on speed and resilience to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent.

This UWx Control deck focuses on disruption and card advantage to control the game through counterspells, removal, and powerful planeswalkers like Narset and Teferi. It utilizes a variety of tools like Force of Will, Swords to Plowshares, and Prismatic Ending to handle threats, while also leveraging cards like Brainstorm and Ponder for card selection. The inclusion of cards like L√≥rien Revealed and Forth Eorlingas! provides additional utility and flexibility in different matchups. The main goal of the deck is to outvalue opponents and establish control over the game by managing threats efficiently.

This deck focuses on quickly assembling the combo of Nomads en-Kor and Cephalid Illusionist to mill your library, allowing you to bring back Thassa's Oracle or Dread Return to win the game immediately. Using cards like Ponder, Brainstorm, and Teferi, Time Raveler to dig for combo pieces and protect your combo with Force of Will and Daze. Urza's Saga can tutor for combo pieces like Shuko, while Prismatic Ending and Cabal Therapy provide disruption and control options. The goal is to set up the combo as quickly and efficiently as possible to secure a win.
